boat

Class SecurityZone

  • java.lang.Object
    • boat.SecurityZone

  • public class SecurityZone
extends java.lang.Object
    SecurityZone defines the zone where we consider the boat as not stolen

    A SecurityZone instance is characterized by the following :

    • A GPS current position (where the boat is right now)
    • A GPS initial position (where the boat was parked)
    • A maximal distance corresponding to the radius of the zone
    • The distance from the center of the zone
    • An indicator of the alarm
    Author:
    Guillaume Le Boucher

      • SecurityZone

        public SecurityZone(GPS current_pos,
                    GPS initial_pos,

        SecurityZone Constructor.

        Through construction, the SecurityZone is initialized with position 0,0 if not chosen

        Parameters:
        current_pos - The current position of the boat
        initial_pos - The initial position of the boat
        maxDistance - The radius of the security zone

      • updatePosition

        public int updatePosition(GPS newPosition)
        Updates the position of the boat, computes the new distance from the center and updates the alarm
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        public int updateAlarm()
        Checks if the actual distance form the center is greater than the maximal distance allowed
        Returns:
